"Thats the most points I've ever scored," Jerry Stackhouse said, who is the NBA's second-leading scorer behind former teammate Allen Iverson . This is the highest level of basketball that you can play and I can say that I did this. It is definitely something I will remember for a long time. And I really think I can do it again. Michael Jordan did most of his prolific scoring in Chicago Stadium prior to his first retirement and never scored more than 55 points in the United Center, which opened in 1994.
